slides.script:
Hello and welcome...
Today’s topic is Describing Data and Trends — a key academic skill.
slides.title: Describing Data & Trends

slides.script: You’ll often use this when writing reports or giving presentations.
slides.title: Interpreting Academic Visuals

slides.script:
Let’s start with some essential vocabulary...
increase, decrease, fluctuate, peak, plateau.
slides.title: Essential Vocabulary

slides.script: For example: “The number of applicants increased sharply in 2022.”
slides.title: Vocabulary in Context

slides.script:
Now let’s talk about grammar for trend descriptions.
Past Simple vs. Present Perfect.
slides.title: Grammar Focus

slides.script: Use comparative phrases like: “more than,” “less than,” “as much as.”
slides.title: Making Comparisons

slides.script:
Academic English values accuracy and objectivity.
Describe only what the data shows.
slides.title: Academic Objectivity

slides.script:
Instead of saying “The drop was probably due to poor marketing,” say:
“There was a 20% drop in sales between March and June.”
slides.title: Correct vs. Incorrect

slides.script: Here’s a quick challenge: describe this sample chart in 2–3 sentences.
slides.title: Practice Prompt

slides.script:
To sum up: good data descriptions are clear, concise, and based on evidence.

slides.title: Conclusion & Quiz Teaser
